docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's Richard Kilty overcame a sluggish start to retain his 60 meters title at the European indoor athletics championships on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: Athletics: Britain's Kilty Retains 60 Meters Title
headline.main: Athletics: Britain's Kilty Retains 60 Meters Title

docs.lead_paragraph: An explosion has killed four people at a home in a Mexico City suburb where a massive fireworks market blast left dozens dead in December.

headline.print_headline: Gas Blast Kills 4 in Mexico City Suburb Famous for Fireworks
headline.main: Gas Blast Kills 4 in Mexico City Suburb Famous for Fireworks

docs.lead_paragraph: An Oklahoma lawmaker who once likened Islam to cancer required Muslims to answer several written questions — including, "Do you beat your wife?" — before agreeing to meet with them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Six shelter dogs looking to be adopted are playing fetch at the Brazil Open in Sao Paulo, giving tennis fans a demonstration of their ball-retrieving skills.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mexican federal police rescued 31 Cuban immigrants who had been held in a house in the resort city of Cancun, the government said on Saturday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Liverpool rediscovered flashes of their most vibrant attacking form to repel an Arsenal fightback at a jubilant Anfield on Saturday and leapfrog Arsene Wenger's men in the battle for Champions League places.

headline.print_headline: Wijnaldum Seals Liverpool Win Over Arsenal
headline.main: Wijnaldum Seals Liverpool Win Over Arsenal

docs.lead_paragraph: Tommy Page, a former pop star whose song "I'll Be Your Everything" went to No. 1 in 1990 and who later became a record company executive, publisher of Billboard magazine, a vice president at Pandora and an executive at The Village Voice, has died. He was 46.

headline.print_headline: Veteran Music Executive and Former Pop Star Tommy Page Dies
headline.main: Veteran Music Executive and Former Pop Star Tommy Page Dies

docs.snippet: Tommy Page, a former pop star whose song "I'll Be Your Everything" went to No. 1 in 1990 and who later became a record company executive, publisher of Billboard magazine, a vice president at Pandora and an executive at The Village Voice, has died....
